title: Man discovers wife is cheating with a text on her smartwatch
text:
"I wanted to end this marriage of 13 years right there and then.”

Cheating can be hurtful and confusing. But it's rarely just about sex.

It seems crazy to think the subtle vibration of a smartwatch would be powerful enough to end a marriage.

But as *Bill grabbed his wife *Ruby’s watch from the charger, that was exactly what was about to happen.

You might be sceptical that a simple message alert could carry quite that much power – but it makes perfect sense.

After all, a relationship never falls apart in the dramatic way that you would imagine.

Instead, it shatters because of one tiny moment which finally confirms the truth.

As Bill shared on Reddit, it would only take one piece of evidence to validate his months of doubt and fear about Ruby's faithfulness.

The smartwatch contained the evidence Bill needed to prove the affair. Source: iStock

"It was the longest night of my life"

As Bill looked down at the message on the tiny screen, he knew instantly that it was from Ruby’s secret boyfriend.

It was the proof he had been looking for.

But now that he finally had it, Bill had no idea what to do with it.

“I did not sleep a wink all night or all of the next morning... or into the afternoon,” Bill said.

"It was the longest night of my life. I wanted to end this marriage of 13 years right there and then.”

"Would a divorce send him over the edge?”

The only thing stopping Bill from walking out the door right there and then was the thought of their three kids, who are all under 10.

He was especially worried about their son, who has an anxiety disorder - as well as several other neurological issues.

“Would a divorce send him over the edge?”Bill worried.

“His anxiety has improved with many hours of therapy - but I live in fear of a return to his days of debilitating anxiety.”

“The next bit really took me by surprise"

In the end, Bill decided that he needed to gather some more evidence before he made a decision... so he got to work and started digging.

The message on the watch had shown the man’s name - but Bill needed more information than that.

So he started combing through their family phone plan, looking for numbers that stood out.

“Next stop, reverse phone lookup on whitepages.com,” Bill explained.

“I punched in the first of the numbers and guess what, the initials that came up were right. I got lucky the first time.

“The next bit took me by surprise.”

"I recognised it straightaway"

It wasn’t just the man’s name that was familiar to Bill – he also recognised his address.

He lived in the home Bill and Ruby had lived when the first got married and started a family.

“We used to live there, we used to own that house,” Bill said.

“I had sold him that house more than six years ago.

“The next few days involved more sleuthing and to make a long story short, the best I can surmise, she is an avid runner and she is a member of a running club.

“Looks like he joined the same running club circa May. The affair started after that.”

"I still don’t know what to do"

It's now been several months since Bill learned the truth and he still hasn’t left Ruby.

He still paralysed with crippling indecision - torn between the desire to leave and the need to stay.

“Some days it hurts more than I can take and I toy around with asking my kids' forgiveness and file for divorce,” he said.

“Other days, I try to remind myself that I love them more than I hate her.

“The part about starting a new life is preying on my mind too. I am 44. Can I really delay leaving?

“I still don’t know.”

*Names have been changed
